intro: Erigeron macrophyllus, commonly known as the showy fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its large, showy white or pale yellow composite flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant has a basal rosette of broad, heart-shaped leaves and grows in a variety of habitats including meadows and disturbed soils. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Erigeron macrophyllus is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and attracts pollinators like butterflies and bees.
